poem:
### Single by Choice

The morning light enters  
through parted curtains  
casting gentle shadows  
on a hopeful future.  
Her friends pair off  
in photograph frames,  
while she chooses  
a different canvas—  
a solitary brush  
painting her heart's desire,  
each stroke bold,  
a mother solo,  
with a lullaby of one.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "I want be a single mum, but feel envious of peers with partners | Ask Annalisa Barbieri I am a very lucky person who has a huge amount to be happy and grateful for. But although I have many excellent friendships, I have had very few romantic relationships. I am now 36 and after 10 years of giving dating a real “go”, I have decided to become a single mum by choice. This has been a very positive". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
